hi and welcome you're listening to the

changing quickly will the u.s. be left
out now before I get started I just want
to make an announcement on Thanksgiving

spotlight YouTube channel so all you

right on the site or go to steam it at
sistema com4 slash @ x 20 to report and
you can play the interview right on
steam it let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now as we've
been saying we've been saying that this
holiday season most likely is going to
be a complete and utter disaster for
retail and that has nothing to do with
online sales I know people are gonna
start to bring that up that yes online
is doing a lot better even if it does
and they tell you this billions of
dollars increase in online sales
remember it retails a trillion dollar
business and this is a very small
fraction of the retail industry but we
can see already that stores are really
getting hit and I think this is going to
get worse as time goes on the corporate
media I know is out there saying that
you know look at the lines on Black
Friday everything looks amazing people
are out there shopping but again we
don't have the real numbers all we have
is the corporate media out there pushing
propaganda trying to get to pee trying
to get the everyday person out there to
shop but we see right now that j.crew
they're saying that listen sales are not
good whatsoever they're down 12% in the
third quarter they're gonna be worse
probably in the fourth quarter we're not
gonna be able to keep things going and
moving along here we're gonna be closing
50 more stores and I think we're gonna
see a lot more retailers come out and
say you know something we just didn't
have a good Christmas a good holiday
season and we're gonna start closing
some stores here we've seen a lot of
stores closed since the beginning of the
of the year and I think it's going to
continue on as we move forward we see
you already that just 10 companies
for 33% of all market gains now was very
interesting is why would PE rise at a
time when the Fed is tightening now so
Jen speculated assuming that analysts
have not factored tax reform into their
earnings forecast tax reform
expectations have been the driver for of
PE expansion now there is a problem with
this
while the sp500 index rate is currently
around twenty six point six percent
assuming that the US companies generate
around forty three percent of their
profits abroad and paid thirty five
percent of their US profits on taxes the
average tax rate outside the US would be
around fifteen point five percent a
decrease in the u.s. tax from thirty
five to twenty percent as planned by
Trump's tax reform would thus
theoretically boost earnings by eight
point five percent the 12-month Ford PE
has risen by twelve percent over the
last twelve months
in other words roughly a hundred and
fifty percent of trumps tax cuts have
been priced in now so Jen calculated
that ten contributors of the sp500 bull
run have accounted for thirty three
percent of the S&P 500 performance now
tying everything together the bank also
points out that all of the companies
listed below have been have seen their
PE expand over the last 12 months in
some cases Walmart Boeing Amazon have
dramatically increased their PE in fact
only three companies Apple and two banks
have 12-month PE s that are below the
market average so when we're looking at
this we have to wonder what is going on
here and I think there's a lot of
manipulation I think there's a lot that
we don't know behind the scenes and
again when things start to crash and
fall apart this is when the truth starts
to really come out we see the u.s. PMI
has tumbled to four-month lows which
signals around a two percent GDP growth
and remember GDP has been manipulated
they've gone all the way back to 1929
included research and development and
manipulated GDP numbers even further
than that
and we can see that a lot of the GDP
about 70% of it is made up of retail
spending now if retail is doing poorly
how were these GDP numbers moving up we
also know that health care and of course
with Obamacare that really boosted GDP
because as premiums go up guess what so
does GDP so we also see that that / US
service business activity
well that hit a low a four-month low we
see US manufacturing PMI it's at a
two-month low US manufacturing output is
it at - is at a two-month low and we're
starting to see that things aren't going
as well as everyone thinks now we
understand that we have a lot of debt
not just here in the United States but
around the world and when we look at the
debt here in the United States we can
see that the gross national debt in the
US hit around twenty point five trillion
or 105 percent of GDP but when we look
at Japan their national debt is around
250 250 percent of GDP but whose debt
bubble is going to burst
first well China is now where Japan was
before it's credible bubble blew up in
the early 90s but guess what Canada
Canada rules their private sector debt
in Canada has more than doubled from 2.2
trillion in 2006 to four point five
trillion and private sector debt as a
parent as a percent of GDP has soared to
217 percent and guess what this is
within a hair of where Japan was in the
third quarter of 93 before the credit
bubble imploded so who's going to be
first it looks like Canada is leading
the pack right now now everyone's out
there saying well yeah we see a lot of
debt we see that the economy is not
doing well but we see all we also see
the manipulation and I think the central
bank can keep this going forever well a
lot of people said that back in 2008
where they thought everything was going
to continue on forever and Eric actually
back then everyone believed the illusion
that everything was great we've been
looking at everything right now we know
that things are not going well we know
that inflation is starting to creep up
everything behind the scenes of what the
Fed and the government is telling us we
see that things are really breaking down
very quickly now I know we have the
crypto market we have the gold market
and people saying they I forget about
gold let's go to crypto I think all of
these are important in their own way
where crypto which is an electronic form
of currency which I believe will be
great for decentralization it will take
the power away from the Fed if they
don't get their hands around it and I
think it puts the creation of currency
back into the people's hands and plus
it's electronic so it's very easy to use
around the world and no one is dependent
on a centralized system I also think
gold silver and other precious metals
are very good to have I mean there are
many reasons why gold is very good it's
tangible
with inherent value there is no
counterparty risk it's a store of value
and it's been a store of value for a
very long time it's a long-term
inflation hedge it has a 16 a 6,000 year
history a 2,500 year track record as
money it's a safe haven and it's
portable anonymous wealth where you can
take these gold coins deep physical bars
and you don't have to you know nobody
can really track this it's very
difficult to track and you can move it
from one area to another plus it's
universally accepted in all different
areas and yes when you purchase gold
they be fed and the the government's
they might write it down but if you get
it in smaller denominations they have no
clue that you have it if you get silver
they really don't have any idea that you
have this and this is why they would
like to go to an electronic form of
their currency and I'm not talking about
cryptocurrency unless they come up with
their coin and they force everyone to
use it they can track every one but they
like to use electronic version of their
currency because it makes it very easy
for them to
in you it makes it very easy to track
all your purchases because you're using
your debit card to your credit card and
we see right now that there's reasons to
have gold there's reasons to have
cryptocurrency because depending on the
situation
you're gonna need both and we see that
the situation is changing very rapidly I
mean think about this
out in the Middle East the Middle East
is changing we know China Russia and in
many of the Asian countries they're
buying into the one belt one road system
the Silk Road system and we see that
Turkey Iran Russia India Syria well
they're all going to be part of this new
system now Syria is the key to the
economic integration of the Eurasia
through energy and transportation
connections Syria will have a direct
link to Europe and this is why Russia
has stepped in this is why they wanted
to remove the Islamic state from there
and we know that the Cabal wanted to
build a gas pipeline through Syria and
supply gas throughout Europe control
Syria get to Iran lock down their
natural resources like oil use the petro
dollar on oil but we see right now that
a stable Syria is crucial to China
Russia India Iran so they can build the
belt and Road and everything will be
connected it's almost like Syria is a
hub to all of this and we see right now
that things are rapidly changing in the
economic system and the thing is will
the United States be a part of this and
I think slowly but surely the United
States will have to be a part of this
because if we're left out in the cold
we're not gonna survive that long and
we're gonna have major major problems
here because right now the United States
manufacturers are very little bit I
think we're gonna need a lot of trading
partners I think we're gonna need part
we're gonna need to be part of this Silk
Road system to maintain and continue on
with our economy and once the United
States is no longer the reserve
currency of the world this is when
everything starts to change this is the
way this is when our way of life starts
to change this is when the value of the
currency starts to change this is when
we need to manufacture it this is when
we need to create trade with other
partners this is when we can't sanction
countries to force them into doing other
things and we can see the economic
system is rapidly changing and it's
accelerating right now and everything is
going to change very very quickly in the
year of 2018 and we're gonna see major
changes all over the place and this is
why everyone needs to be ready and
prepared because the economy first of
all is ripping itself apart everything
is deteriorating and pretty soon the
everyday person is gonna start to really
notice that things aren't going as well
as the corporate media as the Fed the
government is saying that things are
really breaking down very very quickly
and we can see once that starts to
happen people are going to panic people
are going to say what's going on here
and things are going to break down and
this is why you need to be ready and
prepared for that time
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
